intro: Gnaphalium fulgidum, commonly known as the golden weed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as wetlands and stream banks, and it produces small, yellow to golden flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it is known for its ability to thrive in wet, nutrient-rich soils. Gnaphalium fulgidum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardiness and ability to stabilize soil.
